profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T18:08-0400

did.unittitle: U.S. Army Registers, Regulations, Orders, etc.
did.abstract: This is a compilation of manuscript and printed items, with some extensive annotations by Parker on the published items. There are various editions of the "Army Register," or "Register of the Army of the U.S.," from 1813-1816, published both in Washington and Philadelphia, with Parker's corrections, additions, and manuscript versions appended. Some of the volumes contain printed regulations, orders, and laws, with his annotations, such as "An Act for Establishing Rules & Articles . . . of the Armies of the U.S." (Washington, 1808); General orders, 1815; U.S. War dept. Letter from the Secretary of war...relative to the...act fixing the military peace establishment... 1816; U.S. Congress. House. Military Committee. Report...1817; U.S. War dept. Letter from the acting Secretary of war...relative to a mutiny said to have taken place at Norfolk...1817. The contents of "U.S. Army Registers, Regulations, Orders, etc., 1801-1815" are listed as: strength of the army; distribution of the officers; commanders of regiments; number of officers authorized by law; strength of regiments; distribution of the army at the close of the war; strength of the army in 1817; a correct register of the army...at the close of the campaign of 1814; regulations, orders, registers, and reports to Congress; etc.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: United States. War Dept. Inspector General's Office..

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Presented by Daniel Parker, August 15, 1817. See in-house shelf list for additional accession numbers.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Attorney Daniel Parker served as Adjutant Inspector-General in the U.S. Army.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: These three volumes contain the U.S. Army Registers for 1813-1816. These volumes contain the official rules and regulations for the Army and other official documents. Although the Registers were printed, Parker makes occasional notes in the margins and includes handwritten lists of regiments, officers, and divisions.

did.abstract: Kept by Daniel Parker, 1782-1846, these two volumes are also a compilation of manuscript and printed items with extensive annotations by Parker on the published items. The first of the two volumes, Army Registers, Laws, is dated 1801-1809; the second, Army Registers, 1813-1817; they both contain primarily the same information as the first volume, U.S. Army Registers: staff, enlisted men, pay, etc.
did.physdesc: D.and printed items. 2vols. Bound with this are printed U.S.Army items; 1809-1817.

origination.label: creator

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Presented by Daniel Parker; June 20, 1817. See letter of Parker to Cutbush; June 11, 1817.
